oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spanning k-ended trees of 3-regular connected graphs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zoeram, Hamed Ghasemian
Yaqubi, Daniel
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Combinatorics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A tree is called k-ended tree if it has at most k leaves, where a leaf is a vertex of degree one. In this paper we prove that every 3-regular connected graph with n vertices such that n is greater than 8 has spanning sub tree with at most [(2n+4)/9]-ended tree. At the end we give a conjecture about spanning k-ended trees on 3-regular connected graphs.
